definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: In the late 18th century coal became one of the most sought-after natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 十八世纪末期，煤炭成为最抢手的自然资源。

sentences.english: He also insisted United would not fleece fans despite the demand for season tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他还强调虽然季票很抢手，但是球队不会压榨球迷。

sentences.english: You are a good catch if you are self-reliant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是一个独立自主的人，你就是一个抢手货。

sentences.english: Ice-cream moon cakes are selling like hot cakes.
sentences.chinese: 冰祺淋月饼是最为抢手货。

sentences.english: Five years on, the card is an increasingly sought-after document.
sentences.chinese: 历经5年，中国绿卡正变得越来越抢手。

sentences.english: Now traditional Chinese medicine to improve one's immunity has become a fast-selling product.
sentences.chinese: 现在增强免疫力的中药成了抢手货。

sentences.english: You are a good catch if you are honest and can be trusted.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能诚实且被信任，你就是个抢手货。

sentences.english: Because the flight was overbooked , so I decided to be bumped.
sentences.chinese: 因为机票抢手，所以我决定取消定位了。

sentences.english: Massage chairs are popular gifts for Father's Day.
sentences.chinese: 按摩椅一向是父亲节的抢手礼物。

sentences.english: Check out these five smart online degree options.
sentences.chinese: 来看看下列五个抢手的在线学位。

sentences.english: A popular singer's new CD will be selling like hotcakes as soon as it is released.
sentences.chinese: 一位流行歌手的新CD可能一发布就会很抢手。

sentences.english: But Sarah Palin is still expected to be a popular choice.
sentences.chinese: 但是佩琳的装束估计会成为抢手货。

sentences.english: The services of China's Zheng Zhi are in demand with the English Premier League (EPL).
sentences.chinese: 中国球员郑智最近成了英超球队的抢手货。

sentences.english: But even at such high prices, memberships are still eagerly sought.
sentences.chinese: 但是即使是如此高的价格，会员资格仍然是抢手货。

sentences.english: London's accident and emergency services are desperate at the best of times.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的急症室正处于史上最抢手的时期。

sentences.english: Now it strove to be even more welcoming, almost silly.
sentences.chinese: 现在它正近乎愚蠢地试图变得更抢手。

definition: (a product) sells well/to be in demand
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
the rarer sth is, the greater its value (idiom)
lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
many wolves and not enough meat/not enough to go around
